input: joke: Why don't you ever see elephants hiding in trees? Because they're so good at it.
validityText:
The input provided is a joke: "Why don't you ever see elephants hiding in trees? Because they're so good at it." According to the input specification, a valid input is one that constitutes a joke, whether in a sentence or set of sentences. There are no content restrictions, as humor is subjective, and the joke can be expressed in any language or construct.

In this case, the input fits the criteria. It is a joke composed of two sentences that form a coherent and humorous question-and-answer format. The humor is subjectively derived from the unexpected twist in the punchline. The content doesn't break any specified rules nor does it contain language or constructs that could make it non-compliant per the input specification.
